meanings.definition: To allocate or distribute resources in a different way.
meanings.sent1: The teacher reallocates the crayons to different tables for the art project.
meanings.sent2: The company reallocates its budget to focus more on marketing this quarter.
meanings.sent3: The magician reallocates the rabbits to different hats for his next trick.
meanings.sent4: The captain reallocates the crew members to different tasks to ensure a smooth sailing.
meanings.sent5: The gardener reallocates the plants to different pots for better sunlight exposure.

meanings.definition: To assign or designate something to a different purpose or recipient.
meanings.sent1: The manager reallocates the project to a more experienced team member.
meanings.sent2: The charity reallocates the donations to support a new cause.
meanings.sent3: The chef reallocates the ingredients to create a new dish on the menu.
meanings.sent4: The coach reallocates the players to different positions for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent5: The librarian reallocates the books to different shelves for better organization.
